text: Sounds good. My course also taught both 3d and comp, really good to know both even if your interests lie in 3D. I was sure I wanted to be an editor, then motion graphics artist, then colourist, then I finally stuck with 3D/CG. Took me a few years to find what I really loved. You'd like to persue 3d modeling right?

yes 3d modelling, specifically doing complex hard surfacing modeling as well as wanted to create environments for vfx. my problem is currently i rely on 3d modelling tutorials to create complex objects. for  example, right now i am trying to design a sci-fi tron inspired bike using orthographic buti struggle modelling with a clean topology in mind
is there anyway we can meet face to face, as it will be more efficient for me
